result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Carl Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Waushara Co Case No. 2015CM000370

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.  Defendant to comply with any other terms or conditions imposed by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Carl Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: SDC Letter returned undeliverable-unable to forward
Attachment to warrant-60 days or PIF $1872.00
Contempt-60 days in the WC Jail-stayed. $150/month starting July 1, 2016
Financial Statement for Failure to Pay

15CM-370 and 15CM-486 - Both Cases Called @ 1:05 PM:  Defendant Michael Carl Johnson in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global joint recommendation for resolution recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.  Court entertains waiver of personal appearance by Def and counsel today.  Court accepts voluntary waiver of personal appearance and matters will proceed via video conferencing.   15CM-486:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant (will be filed by SPD following Court today).  No prohibitions on proceeding today.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  15CM-370 Plea (Misd FTR):  NC  15CM-486 Plea (Misd BJump):  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Accepts resolution reached.  S/W as to each charge - 2 yrs probation. Concurrent terms.  Conditions:    The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court; any other terms or conditions imposed by the Supervising Agent; Court Costs, plus DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Def will go on to Oneida Co to address other jurisdiction warrant.  Appeal Rights Faxed to WCJ.
